urls.title: Flooding: planning, managing and recovering from a flood
urls.description: Making a personal flood plan; what to do if a flood is forecast; what to do if a flood happens; cleaning up after a flood.

tweets.text:
Flood alerts have been sounded ‚Äì keep up to date with weather forecasts @MetOffice and advice from the @EnvAgencyNW 

Take regular medicines? Keep them close at hand in case you have to leave quickly See @PHE_uk advice here https://t.co/uYa7NYyyp6 #flooding https://t.co/82bGi6gpy9

domain.description: Top level interests and hobbies groupings, like Food or Travel

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Category
domain.description: A grouping of interests and hobbies entities, like Novelty Food or Destinations

tweets.text:
Our Flood Risk Manager @AndynBrown16 has been in #Croston where we have been operating one of our flood storage basins.

Make sure you sign up for flood warnings here: https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ohmPMGkd1L

Turn around, don't drown!

Remember just one egg cup of water is enough to wreck your engine, and just 15cm of moving water is enough to impact a small car.

Don't drive through floodwater.
@EnvAgency | @itvanglia | @itvweather https://t.co/Gt2T4L1Fj8

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
More heavy rain is forecast overnight. Don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks ‚Äì always avoid flood water. Check the flood risk in your area:  

https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/xHzsaCyYwu

Please have a look at the tweets below with info from @lancashirecc and @EnvAgencyNW We are working with all our partners to be ready to respond to any #StormChristoph flooding issues if they arise.  You can follow #lancsalert here and on Facebook for all the latest info üëç https://t.co/E3DLCTS8fc

tweets.text:
There are #FloodWarnings in place as #StormChristoph brings heavy rain across England.  

Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7Fwblnq  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MaE7ptFod2

Flood Warning now in force 

#Walsden #Todmorden

Take action now. Full info on https://t.co/bu3QGSUXpT

@WYP_CldrValleys @Calderdale @Tod_Flood_Group  @EnvAgencyYNE @metofficeYorks https://t.co/EzB8bG3K8W

Ironbridge temporary flood barriers going up tomorrow. 

Due to heavy rain across Shropshire & upper Severn, barriers are needed to protect communities from #flooding. 

Wharfage resurfacing prep work had started, however this work is postponed while the barriers are needed. https://t.co/sY7ue1o4Lf

UPDATE: Siren activated in #Walsden by @EnvAgencyYNE where river levels at highest. @Calderdale @WestYorksPolice staff on site supporting local residents. All flood plans to be activated. #StormChristoph

*Flooding update*

Flood Alerts have been re-issued for the Lower Don, River Idle, River Went and River Dearne.

This covers the following areas: Bawtry, Bentley, Conisborough, Clay Lane, Fishlake, Intake, Mexborough, Scawthorpe, Tickhill and Wadworth. https://t.co/gXOnQ7JOWP

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

domain.name: TV Episodes

tweets.text: We've just issued a #flood warning for Walsden Water at #Walsden because #flooding is expected following heavy rain. Get the latest flood information & sign up to receive flood warnings here: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/IvPRqI0DJf

Flood alerts are in place for three areas of Rotherham. The Council is taking steps to protect at risk residential areas.

Follow @EnvAgency and @EnvAgencyYNE for the latest updates.

More information on our website: https://t.co/EUSqZinZO1 https://t.co/E1A5RXrCGB

We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

tweets.text: Just getting updated from @EnvAgencyNW #Cumbria and #Lancashire incident team and we are getting important gaps in the rain from #StormChristoph that allows rivers to recover, particularly where we have had heavy showers #wigton https://t.co/bvPGP7DSsQ

The flood siren is sounding in Walsden where @EnvAgencyYNE is expecting homes to be flooded with rising river level.  
#StormChristoph https://t.co/QmEyLfyESc

@FiMorris2 @EnvAgencyYNE Wow two pairs of glasses, lots of drinks and three screens! Clearly not your first rodeo. But where are the biscuits? You can‚Äôt be a duty officer without biscuits... or flapjacks. Isn‚Äôt that right @HindsHelen

urls.title: Save bees from deadly pesticides
urls.description: We can‚Äôt allow pesticides to destroy our environment and kill any more bees.

tweets.text:
The Environment Minister, George Eustice has approved an emergency use of a bee-killing pesticide, but we need to remind him that we‚Äôre in the middle of a climate and nature emergency! 

Sign this petition to protect bees: https://t.co/RAqu03kddA https://t.co/JA27XKQ4oW

tweets.text:
#DoYouKnow what to do in flood? 

#StormChristoph will bring widespread flood alerts and warnings across the North West over the next few days. 

Check your flood risk here ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/ZAITy41Ta6 https://t.co/GMyAQDBuRU

@LancasterCC sweeping teams will be out about into the night.

All we can do though is keep channels clear. 

In some areas the volume of water will be so great it will be a case of waiting for it to drain.

Seen lots of @LancashireCC @LancsPolice @EnvAgencyNW  @LancashireFRS https://t.co/HkNzNiUoeE

tweets.text:
Please RT: trailers of waste have been found abandoned across the country, putting the environment at risk.

The Joint Unit for Waste Crime is investigating this.

If you've seen anything, contact Crimestoppers anonymously or call 0800 807060. https://t.co/mNMYwK0bd9

Today @JamesBevanEA told us that #StormChristoph is set to bring expecting 'heavy and prolonged' rainfall onto saturated ground, posing risks of flooding to a 'substantial number' of properties and communities.

He lays out the steps that @EnvAgency are taking here üëá https://t.co/NLEokNjBNx
Handover done and I have taken over as Environment Agency NE Area Duty Manager until 10pm #StormChristoph #floodaware #flooding @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/0FdL8VAxPE

tweets.text:
Significant rainfall is expected over the next few days, with many areas across England at risk of #flooding.

Sign up for flood warnings for your local area: https://t.co/Ajxpqpf8eE

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/gFP68SGZMD

.@EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA tells @CommonsEFRA that #StormChristoph brings 24 to 48 hours of heavy rain to ground that is already saturated. #TeamEA on the ground working with partners to prepare. Check your flood risk here: https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY https://t.co/DD7vHRRfXh

tweets.text:
River levels are expected to rise in our area this week.

üì© Sign up to receive flood warnings https://t.co/I4DMBiMe34

üîé Search for warnings and alerts near you https://t.co/Jc9hMf6wuH

üö® What to do in an emergency https://t.co/lIwXZCHi7u

Follow @EnvAgencySE for updates

An @EnvAgencyYNE flood warning is in force for Walsden Water. River levels across the Upper River Calder have risen and are now approaching levels where we expect properties to flood. Please take care and be prepared. Visit https://t.co/SOPqHGairw for advice. https://t.co/Xa21H6xf44

There are a number of flood warnings in place across England, with heavy rainfall expected in the next few days.

By knowing what to do in a #flood, you can reduce the impacts to your home, family and possessions.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#StormCristoph https://t.co/FMPUiziILV

Making a journey this week? Please do not drive through #flood water. Check your route before you travel: https://t.co/tumDuoEmi2 Remember just one egg cup of water is enough to wreck your engine. #StormChristoph  #PrepareActSurvive #SafetyFirst https://t.co/di6rCwoPtZ

tweets.text: Flood alerts remain in place across Rochdale Borough - follow @EnvAgencyNW for the latest updates. üëá https://t.co/ZijoEwDYMk
This afternoon at the River Kent - seems like the river is coping well so far at this point. #StormChristoph #kent @EnvAgency https://t.co/xjoeGsTkxk

Monksleaze was closed early this morning, the Sowy has returned to its normal winter level. We will be allowing the KSD level to fall substantially overnight to allow for some new flow monitoring equipment to be installed before the next band of rain comes in. #KSD  @EnvAgencySW

Huge thank you to our operations staff, working round the clock putting up barriers, installing pumps, clearing debris etc. üôè

Behind the scenes we have 100s of staff across the country are monitoring rain & river levels. Taking action to help keep people safe. #FloodAware https://t.co/aDYZ3PhoYi

Heavy rain is forecast overnight and the risk of flooding remains across South #Yorkshire. 

Thank you to our emergency services, @EnvAgencyYNE, @YorkshireWater and our local council's who are working round the clock to keep us safe.

Over the coming days heavy rain is forecast for Yorkshire and the North East as #StormChristoph hits the region.  To sign up for flood alerts please visit the @EnvAgency website https://t.co/08qhBLjngI people can also call our Incident Hotline on 0800 80 70 60 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/z5e85DblaG

@ProfJGrey @dalesarch @DefraGovUK @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE @EAGeomorphology @BiodiversityEA @YorkDalesRT @Jack_Hirst3 @wildlifetoursuk @yorkshire_dales @SandTCUKYorks @ilkleyIain @DefraNature There have to be little brown trout in there.

Plans are in place for potential flooding incidents in Northwich over the next few days: https://t.co/AJlXlmmDT7

Follow @EnvAgencyNW and sign up to receive flood alerts and warnings at: https://t.co/lEDfKdIQld #FloodAware #StormChristoph https://t.co/LizhbO6OD8
Flood alerts and warnings are in place for the North East. Keep up to date with weather forecasts from @metoffice @metofficeNEEng and advice from @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/sTxr3zNrlX
